summary: The firefighting foam DOD has used for decades contains chemicals that, at elevated exposure levels, can increase risks of cancer or other health issues. As a result, DOD: spent about $200 million on investigations and response (as of December 2016) identified 401 installations with known or potential releases of these chemicals took actions, like providing alternative drinking water, at 32 locations (as of August 2017)...
title: Drinking Water: Status of DOD Efforts to Address Drinking Water Contaminants Used in Firefighting Foam
